channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 17,000 AT&T workers across the Southeast strike over contract negotiations
item.description: The Communications Workers of America, the union representing the striking employees, has accused AT&T of not bargaining "in good faith" during recent contract negotiations.
item.content:encoded:
The Communications Workers of America, the union representing the striking employees, has accused AT&T of not bargaining "in good faith" during recent contract negotiations.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: Body camera shows how a 911 call for medical help led to the killing of Victoria Lee
item.description: Her family said Victoria Lee, 25, from Fort Lee, N.J., was experiencing a mental health crisis when her brother called 911 for medical help. An officer broke into their apartment and fired at her.
item.content:encoded:
Her family said Victoria Lee, 25, from Fort Lee, N.J., was experiencing a mental health crisis when her brother called 911 for medical help. An officer broke into their apartment and fired at her.

(Image credit: New Jersey Office of the Attorney General)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: 'Peak Travel' podcast explores the impact of travel on local communities
item.description: An excerpt from WHYY's podcast "Peak Travel," looking at the aftermath of the Lahaina fire and the Hawaiian islands' complicated relationship with tourism from the mainland.
item.content:encoded: An excerpt from WHYY's podcast "Peak Travel," looking at the aftermath of the Lahaina fire and the Hawaiian islands' complicated relationship with tourism from the mainland.

item.title: New real estate rules could reshape the homebuying process
item.description: NPR's Adrian Ma speaks with NerdWallet's Holden Lewis about how new real estate rules could reshape the homebuying process.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Adrian Ma speaks with NerdWallet's Holden Lewis about how new real estate rules could reshape the homebuying process.
item.dc:creator: Michael Levitt

item.title: Who is Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar?
item.description: NPR's Adrian Ma speaks with New Yorker editor David Remnick about his recent profile of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Adrian Ma speaks with New Yorker editor David Remnick about his recent profile of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar.
item.dc:creator: Michael Levitt

item.title: Ukraine's assault on Russia: What do we know?
item.description: NPR's Adrian Ma speaks with Nick Connolly, who covers Kyiv for German news outlet DW, about the Ukrainian invasion of Russia.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Adrian Ma speaks with Nick Connolly, who covers Kyiv for German news outlet DW, about the Ukrainian invasion of Russia.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Ma

item.title: Burning Man contends with unusually slow ticket sales
item.description: For the first time since 2011, festival organizers are offering rush tickets without requiring preregistration.
item.content:encoded:
For the first time since 2011, festival organizers are offering rush tickets without requiring preregistration.

(Image credit: Julie Jammot)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Perdue recalls 167,000 pounds of frozen chicken that may contain metal
item.description: The voluntary recall of frozen breaded chicken breast tenders and nuggets comes following multiple consumer complaints about metal wire found inside the products.
item.content:encoded: The voluntary recall of frozen breaded chicken breast tenders and nuggets comes following multiple consumer complaints about metal wire found inside the products.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: Former Rep. George Santos is expected to plead guilty in fraud case, AP source says
item.description: Former U.S. Rep. George Santos is expected to plead guilty to multiple counts in his federal fraud case, according to a person familiar with the matter.
item.content:encoded:
Former U.S. Rep. George Santos is expected to plead guilty to multiple counts in his federal fraud case, according to a person familiar with the matter.

(Image credit: Stephanie Scarbrough)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: OpenAI says Iranian group using ChatGPT tried to sow division ahead of U.S. election
item.description: OpenAI said it banned several ChatGPT accounts that generated fake online articles and comments, adding that the content gained little to no reach.
item.content:encoded:
OpenAI said it banned several ChatGPT accounts that generated fake online articles and comments, adding that the content gained little to no reach.

(Image credit: Leon Neal)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim
